full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 751 Filed 08/10/22 Page 132 of 261 1293 LC6VMAX4
1 THE COURT: Is there an objection?
2 MR. EVERDELL: Your Honor, I think --
3 THE COURT: Microphone please.
4 MR. EVERDELL: Sorry, your Honor.
5 I think it does defeat the purpose a bit of not admitting the exhibits just to have the agent testify about those very same --
6 
7 THE COURT: Are you talking about the agent?
8 
9 MR. ROHRBACH: Yes, the agent who conducted the search.
10 
11 THE COURT: Oh, I misunderstood.
12 No, you can't ask the agent unless -- for the same reason. Relevance has to be to the time period.
13 
14 MR. ROHRBACH: That's fine, your Honor. We just wanted to make sure we understood.
15 
16 THE COURT: Thank you for clarifying, Mr. Everdell. I thought you meant the current witness.
17 
18 MR. ROHRBACH: No, not the current witness.
19 MR. EVERDELL: Thank you, your Honor.
20 THE COURT: Thank you.
21 Okay. What else? Anything?
22 MS. POMERANTZ: Nothing from the government.
23 Thank you.
24 THE COURT: All right. Bring in the witness, please.
25 And we'll bring in the jury.
SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300
